body:
Hey @gaspardc-met! Thank you for filing an issue

I am not sure I understand the problem here. You describe "When I develop on a page running a while loop", but the example code does not contain one. Also, the rerun is a special page, so I guess I'm a bit confused.

Can you clarify the Steps to Reproduce and the code. Also can I remove the `initialize_webapp` and `style_metric_cards` for the sake of this repro?

Hey @kmcgrady ,

My bad, I edited the original issue several times, starting with a while loop then trying with `st.rerun` (essentially the same thing for my app that needs to run every minute)

I just now corrected the reproduction code, removing `initialize_webapp` and `style_metric_cards` that have no bearing on the matter. 

So basically the problem boils down to:
- with a vanilla page like page1 at `localhost:8501/page1`, when I edit the page, it stays on page1
- with `page_rerun`, that calls `st.rerun` every second after a `sleep(1)` statement, saving makes the app switch from `localhost:8501/rerun` to `localhost:8501`
@gaspardc-met, how about replacing the `sleep(1)` and `st.rerun` combo with a `st.fragment` that `run_every=1` ?

Ah. @gaspardc-met I was able to reproduce it, and I do think I understand the problem. As a workaround, you can move the page_rerun code to a separate file, and it would work.

In old school streamlit, file changes rerun the whole file. New Streamlit now has as of now two files that can be changed to trigger, and it will rerun the file. Since the function is in the same file as navigation, it reloads the file and starts from scratch

I think we should be able to resolve this, but I'll have to think more on this.

Hi @kmcgrady 
Thanks for looking into it and launching the repro code ! 
The repro was a simplified version and my real layout is using different modules, which doesn't solve the issue. 

However, @edsaac 's suggestion did solve the issue üéâ 
The rendering is not as good, a lot more refreshing is happening on the screen, but at least it works locally üëç 

I think we can close this for now, thanks !

issue.title: Update page script hash on script start if necessary

repository.name: streamlit
repository.description: Streamlit ‚Äî A faster way to build and share data apps.

issue.body:
## Describe your changes

We use `client_state` in the app session in order to handle when a source file changes. We update the page script hash when a script finished event occurs.

The bug this fixes is a scenario where the page script never finishes successfully (in this case, the page always calls `st.rerun()`). We can improve this flow by updating the page script hash on script start event (which we should know by now).

## GitHub Issue Link (if applicable)
Closes #8975

## Testing Plan

- Added Python unit test
- Tested the scenario manually

body:
Good news @gaspardc-met ! I figured out the fix, and it's simple. We update the page info when the script finishes, but with `st.rerun()` the page script never really finishes (which explains why fragments work because the script finishes in this case).

The PR is included above, and you can test it out with https://core-previews.s3-us-west-2.amazonaws.com/pr-9408/streamlit-1.38.0-py2.py3-none-any.whl if you like.
